intro: Lysipomia caespitosa, commonly known as the tufted leafcup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This perennial herb forms dense, clumping growths with slender stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters, often in late summer. Lysipomia caespitosa is adapted to moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
